name: incandescently
content:
incandescently adverb
(VERY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to emphasize how strong a feeling is, especially anger: The incident left queues of incandescently furious drivers. I find it impossible to write about this episode without getting incandescently angry.
used to emphasize how good, special, or skilled something or someone is: It is an incandescently written memoir about his famous family. She was small, blonde, and incandescently beautiful.
More examplesFewer examplesI've been asking myself why this incident blew up quite as incandescently as it did. Everyone loved the charming, graceful, and incandescently energetic teacher.

in a way that is extremely bright, especially because of being very hot: The solar corona is a plume of incandescently hot gas made of atomic particles. Their velocity makes them glow incandescently as they re-enter the atmosphere.
